I'm wondering when ppl. are going to use commas in the right places, and when the fuck ppl. are going to fucking learn that "UTorrent" really spells "µTorrent"!!?

"If you want your download to be fast download U Torrent, search the video Speed up U torrent 1.8 and click on the video that works best for you."

What the fuck is wrong with you?
If you can't really say anything without actually pointing out what it is that you mean - Don't write anything!

That comment (The one I just quoted) was pure and utter gibberish!

Btw, to get the "µ", just press and hold the key "Alt+Gr" while pressing "M". It's also pronounced "My" (Think kinda like thick Irish leprechaun accent, as "Me gold", but in context it's "Micro".

Another thing: The description says "-Disc: 1,5 GB" - Really? The size of the Torrent says 608.46 MiB
Sure you didn't mean "-Disk: 1,5 GB", as in "hard disk drive", or simply "H.D.D."?

In case you didn't pick up on it:

Disc is like a CD (Compact Disc)
Disks are found within hard disk drives (H.D.D.). Non-removable.
